content.text: On the axes below, sketch the graph of \(y = 3\cos 2x - 1\), for \(0^{\circ}\leqslant x^{\circ}\leqslant 360^{\circ}\)
the amplitude of \(y\),
the period of \(y\)
Given that \(y = 4 \sin 6x\), write down
find the value of each of the constants \(a\) and \(b\)
Given that \(\mathrm{r}(x) = \mathrm{p}(x) - \mathrm{q}(x)\) and using your values of \(a\) and \(b\),
find the exact remainder when \(\mathrm{r}(x)\) is divided by \(3x - 2\)
Given that \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) has a remainder of 2 when divided by \(2x + 1\) and that \(\mathrm{q}(x)\) is divisible by \(x + 2\),
The coefficient of \(x^{2}\) in the expansion of \((2 - x)(3 + kx)^{6}\) is equal to 972. Find the possible values of the constant \(k\)
Write \(x^{2} - 9x + 8\) in the form \((x - p)^{2} - q\) , where \(p\) and \(q\) are constants
Hence write down the coordinates of the minimum point on the curve \(y = x^{2} - 9x + 8\)
On the axes below, sketch the graph of \(y = \left|x^{2} - 9x + 8\right|\), showing the coordinates of the points where the curve meets the coordinate axes
Write down the value of \(k\) for which \(\left|x^{2} - 9x + 8\right| = k\) has exactly 3 solutions
Show that \(\theta = \frac{96}{r^2}\)
Given that the minor arc \(AB\) has length \(12\mathrm{cm}\), find the value of \(r\) and of \(\theta\)
Using your values of \(r\) and \(\theta\), find the area of the shaded region

The diagram shows a circle with centre \(O\) and radius \(r\mathrm{cm}\). The minor arc \(AB\) is such that angle \(AOB\) is \(\theta\) radians. The area of the minor sector \(AOB\) is \(48\mathrm{cm}^2\)
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = - \frac{5}{4}\ln 3\) when \(x = 0\)
Hence find the equation of the tangent to the curve at the point where \(x = 0\)
A curve has equation \(y = \frac{\ln(2x^2 + 3)}{5x + 2}\)
Express \(2 + 3\lg x - \lg y\) as a single logarithm to base 10
Hence, given that \(6 \log_{a} 3 + 7 - 3 \log_{3} a = 0\), find the possible values of \(a\)
Find \(\frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{dx}} (5x^2 + 4)^{\frac{3}{2}}\)
Hence find \(\int x(5x^2 + 4)^{\frac{1}{2}} \mathrm{d}x\)
Given that \(\int_{0}^{a}x(5x^{2} + 4)^{\frac{1}{2}}\mathrm{d}x = \frac{19}{15},\)
find the value of the positive constant \(a\)
Find the value of \(s\) when \(t = 0\)
Find the exact value of \(t\) when \(\frac{\mathrm{ds}}{\mathrm{d}t} = 2\)
Find the approximate increase in \(s\) when \(t\) increases from \(\ln 5\) to \(\ln 5 + h\), where \(h\) is small
Variables \(s\) and \(t\) are such that \(s = 4t + 3\mathrm{e}^{- t}\)
Given that \(A\) is at the point with position vector \(\begin{pmatrix} 38 \\ a \end{pmatrix}\) when \(t = 6 \mathrm{s}\), find the value of the constant \(a\).
Particle \(B\) is at the point with position vector \(\begin{pmatrix} 16 \\ 37 \end{pmatrix}\) at time \(t = 0\) and moves with velocity \(\begin{pmatrix} 4 \\ 2 \end{pmatrix} \mathrm{m s}^{- 1}\)
Write down, in terms of \(t\), the position vector of \(B\) at time \(t\)s
Verify that particles \(A\) and \(B\) collide
Write down the position vector of the point of collision

Particle \(A\) is at the point with position vector \(\left( \begin{array}{c}2\\ - 5 \end{array} \right)\) at time \(t = 0\) and moves with a speed of \(10 \mathrm{m s}^{- 1}\) in the same direction as \(\begin{pmatrix} 3 \\ 4 \end{pmatrix}\)
Write down the range of f
Find the exact value of \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}(2.5)\)
f(\(x\)) = 3  \(\cos 2x\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant \frac{\pi}{2}\)
\(\mathrm{g}(x) = 3 - x^{2}\) for \(x \in \mathbb{R}\)
Find the exact solutions of \(\mathrm{g}^{2}(x) = - 6\)
